info.name: Solve the X backend API
info.description: This collection consists of two sections: "Users" and "Players" The "Users" section contains requests for user authentication, registration, and login functionalities, allowing users to access the system securely. The "Players" section includes requests for creating, reading, updating, and deleting player information within the system, facilitating efficient player management. This collection serves as a comprehensive toolkit for managing both users and player data in the application.

item.name: Users

request.description: This request allows new users to create an account within the system. This endpoint is used for user registration and requires users to provide essential information such as username and password. Upon successful registration, the system generates a unique identifier for the user, enabling them to access the system's functionalities.

response.name: No body

request.description: This request is used to authenticate a user and obtain an access token, which should be included in the Authorization response header, for accessing protected resources.

response.name: No body

item.description: The "users" folder contains routes that allow users to interact with the API to authenticate and utilize it properly. These routes are essential for user management within the system.

item.name: Players

request.description: This request creates a player in database with the provided data.

response.name: No body

request.description: This request deletes a player from database based on the provided player id.
This request updates a player from database based on the provided player id and player data.

response.name: No body

item.description: The "players" folder contains routes related to player management within the system. All of these requests are protected, meaning they require authentication using an access token obtained from the Login request. These routes enable users to perform various actions related to players, such as creating, updating, retrieving, and deleting player information.
